question: Paper chromatography is a process used to separate mixtures of substances into their components. The components are carried by a mobile phase through a stationary phase made of absorbent paper. An investigation analyzed a sample of black ink to determine its components.Which property allows the components to separate?
candidate_answers: (A) the solubility of the components in the mobile phase (B) the evaporation rate of the components at a certain temperature (C) the magnetic property of the components (D) the thickness of the paper used as the stationary phase
answer: the magnetic property of the components
label: C
